name: APPLIED PHARMACOLOGY IN NURSING PRACTICE

values.comments:
rinciples of clinical pharmacology are applied to the nursing care of family
members. Proper prescribing and monitoring procedures for the various drug regimens
used to treat various disease states are reviewed. Problems inherent in self-medication,
overuse and abuse of drugs are also considered.
Many students found this course to be very informative. It was helpful in not only
gaining an understanding about different prescription drugs, but also understanding why
some are prescribed instead of others in varying situations. The majority of the lectures
were described as interesting; however, some topics were described as “dense” and were
difficult to follow. A common complaint was that the course failed to cover women’s
health including birth control.
The course is taught by several professors. Professor Boullata received highly
positive reviews and was described as not only a wonderful lecturer, but also a significant
highlight of the course. Other lecturers were less popular and described as having poor
lecturing and presentation skills.
The workload for the class was described as manageable, as there was not a great
deal of work. However, the exams themselves were “challenging” and covered a great
deal of content. Students found these exams were difficult to prepare for.

Principles of clinical pharmacology are applied to the nursing care of family
members. Proper prescribing and monitoring procedures for the various drug regimens
used to treat various disease states are reviewed. Problems inherent in self-medication,
overuse and abuse of drugs are also considered.
Most of the students found this course “dry” and not challenging enough. Also,
some students were disappointed that the content left out some important information.
Students praise Professor Carey for his lectures. However, students did not enjoy
the guest lectures for half the semester.
This course is for graduate nursing students.
